abstract.text: A NSWindowController subclass to display a window to initiate pairing to other bluetooth devices.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Implementation of a window controller to return a NSArray of selected bluetooth devices. This class will handle connecting to the Bluetooth Daemon for the purposes of searches, and displaying the results. This controller will return a NSArray of IOBluetoothDevice objects to the user.

abstract.text: Present an interface through which users can pair their devices with other Bluetooth devices.
A NSWindowController subclass to display a window to initiate pairing to other bluetooth devices.
Adds a UUID to the list of UUIDs that are used to validate the user’s selection.
Adds an array of UUIDs to the list of UUIDs that are used to validate the user’s selection.
Runs the device selector panel as a sheet on the target window.
Resets the controller back to the default state where it will accept any device the user selects.
Returns the title of the default/cancel button in the device selector panel.
Returns the description text that appears in the device selector panel.
Returns the header text that appears in the device selector panel.
Returns the option bits that control the panel’s behavior.
Returns the title of the default/select button in the device selector panel.
Returns the result of the user’s selection.
Returns the search attributes that control the panel’s search/inquiry behavior.
Returns the title of the device selector panel.
Runs the device selector panel in a modal session to allow the user to select a Bluetooth device.
Sets the title of the default/cancel button in the device selector panel.
Sets the description text that appears in the device selector panel.
Sets the header text that appears in the device selector panel.
Sets the option bits that control the panel’s behavior.
Sets the title of the default/select button in the device selector panel.
Sets the search attributes that control the panel’s search/inquiry behavior.
Sets the title of the panel when not run as a sheet.
An NSWindowController subclass that supports the creation of an IOBluetoothObjectPushUIController object.
A NSWindowController subclass to display a window to initiate pairing to other bluetooth devices.
A NSWindowController subclass to display a window to search for and perform SDP queries on bluetooth devices within range.
A controller that manages a window, usually a window stored in a nib file.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A set of methods that support the mediation of a custom segue.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
